main event: On June 24, 1947, a pilot reported seeing nine shiny, saucer-shaped objects flying at high speed over Mt. Rainier, Washington.
interesting points: The objects were described as shiny and flat, reflecting sunlight like mirrors., The pilot estimated the objects were flying at around 1,200 miles per hour., The objects flew in a chain-like formation, similar to a group of geese., The sighting lasted 2-3 minutes, during which the pilot was unable to locate their tails, raising questions about their nature., The incident spurred numerous other sightings across the Pacific Northwest.
